comments.text:
There are many people I know such as these two. I live with them, around 
them and am one. I guess it's what you are taught from the time you are 
very small. Please, don't close your eyes. Smile often and you will see 
other wonderful people coming forward.

top_comment.text:
*SPOİLER* I'm not usually surprised but because of the acting and object 
flaws I missed the obvious. Like the window scene. But it was quiet 
enjoyable. My favourite part was the man saying "Im quite the catch." And 
also you might have missed this part, the mans blood was on the money so 
the man is going to notice that it is from the old lady.﻿
top_comment.author: Kebap Guy

comments.text:
+ranemaker Currency from low to high in notes/bills: $5(pink), $10(blue), 
$20(red), $50(yellow), $100(green). My thoughts was that he didn't think 
she was not offering more, that it was he struggled with having thoughts to 
rob her when he desperately needed the money.
comments.author: xxfrutixx

comments.text: Oh. It makes more sense.
comments.author: Kebap Guy

comments.text:
+ranemaker yea also, the old lady gave her a green bill (100) to pay, and 
she brought back change in a couple of red bills, so the red bills are 
worth a lot less. I think his painful/pissed expression is because he knows 
he needs hundreds of dollars to pay rent that he cant get, and maybe was 
contemplating robbing her but chose not to?
comments.author: Jeremy Li

comments.text:
+Hamad Malik After some Googling of Aussie currency. My thoughts are it was 
a 20 dollar bill because they are red on the ends. Thats why I think he was 
a bit upset, she was offering a 20 when he clearly saw she had more.
comments.author: ranemaker

comments.text: How did his blood get on the money? It looked like it was soaked.
comments.author: Hamad Malik

top_comment.text:
Cute, easy to watch.  Surprised this won.  The story isn't bad, but not 
particular good.
The film panders that feel good moment. Like adding sugar because the story 
is bland. Dash of sugar uplifting music roll credits.  

Director gave every character a brief moment about themselves, except for 
the older lady.  The boss lady had it when she was contemplating her 
decision.  The guy had it, when he eyed the money in the purse, and the 
smile when his truck didn't start.   The pregnant women taking the bus, 
begging for money.   Not the older lady.. don't understand the $800 amount 
on the table except it put a bow on the story﻿
top_comment.author: x13years

comments.text:
I think: the older lady got help from the man when she was in need, so she 
thought she could pass on the goodness. She has been in trouble as well, 
with the flat tire and all.. Hm idk
comments.author: Zakaria ibn Abderrahmân

comments.text: 19 Years - Cash Savage and the Last Drinks

comments.text:
+pudgylumpkins - Whilst it's not as overt as the other characters' moments 
I imagine her gesture was in relation to a time when she was pregnant. It's 
not explicitly said or shown, but that's what I think.
comments.author: Barry Aherne

comments.text:
That's a good point, every character actually had a "we've all been there" 
moment except the older lady. She had a flat tire. Not quite the same as 
the other characters.
comments.author: pudgylumpkins

comments.text: +kris schirmer Cash Savage & The Last Drinks - 19 Years
comments.author: robson alves

comments.text:
i know! ;) that's how life is, because it is all about give and take [with 
love! - coming from the heart which has a healthy connection to the brain.]
what goes around comes around..... ;)
we are moving right now, and i gave lots of things away to people who 
really can use it, and didn't have the good start in life i had.

there always comes the time in life we realize that sharing or giving up on 
things to support orther people is fun. most of the time we have too much 
things anyway. :)))

traveling light through life is better!
love, wisdom and compassion shall be our companion ...
kris
comments.author: kris schirmer

comments.text: This was just great!!!
comments.author: Donna Cavanagh

captions.text: Jess: Oh Cass, do you have a sec?
Cass: If I said no would it matter?
Jess: Um, well something really big has come up and I need more hours.
Cass: Same as you and everybody else.
Jess: What about an advanced pay or something?
Jess: Or I could take day shifts because the tips are a heaps better?
Cass: Jess, if you don't like the arrangements quit.
Jess: Why do you need to be such a...
Cass: Such a what? You think you get special treatment because you're pregnant?
Cass: Don't make this my problem. If you can't look after your baby now I can't help you.
Jess: Wow it's really coming down!
Jess: No worries. Do you want to sit?
Woman: Is it a boy or girl?
Jess: We are praying for a girl but the way it's kicking is telling me it's otherwise.
Jess: Yes, it's kind of scary.
Woman: Next month? Oh my goodness, you should be at home resting.
Jessica: Yeah, um well with the baby and everything I have to work.
Woman: I'm so sorry I didn't - I didn't mean to...
Jessica: No, um let me know when you're ready.
Woman; Well I'm so glad you came along to tell me that.
Woman: Yes they said there will be people coming along soon.
Man: Look why don't you just pop the boot. Let me get at the tire.
Man: Have a look around. How long you been waiting already?
Woman; Are you from around here?
Man: A few towns over. Out this way looking for work.
Jess: Here we go. Oh thanks I'll just grab your change.
Woman: Go on, you need it. Go on.
Man: Thanks but no thanks. We've all been there hey.
Jess: You'll never guess what happened to me today.

title: We've All Been There | Winner of Tropfest Australia 2013
